intro: Galega crocea, commonly known as the yellow borage, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Galega crocea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
